sen.j: 浅井国幹（あざい こっかん、1848年 - 1903年）は、明治時代に漢方復興運動に奔走した日本の医師。
sen.e: Kokkan AZAI (1848-1903) was a Japanese doctor in the Meiji period who engaged in the Kampo (traditional Chinese medicine practiced in Japan) Revival Movement.
Kokkan AZAI (1848-1903) was a Japanese doctor in the Meiji period who engaged in the Kampo (traditional Chinese medicine practiced in Japan) Revival Movement.
Kokkan AZAI (1848-1903) was a Japanese doctor in the Meiji period who engaged in the Kampo (traditional Chinese medicine practiced in Japan) Revival Movement.

sen.j: 名は正典。
sen.e: His real first name was Masatsune.
His real first name was Masatsune.
His real first name was Masatsune.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 国幹の略歴と医師資格制度・漢方復興運動の略史を以下に示す。
sen.e: The following is Kokkan's brief personal history and brief history of the Law of Doctor Licensing System and the Kampo Revival Movement.
The following is Kokkan's brief personal history and brief history of the Law of Doctor Licensing System and the Kampo Revival Movement.
The following is Kokkan's brief personal history and brief history of the Law of Doctor Licensing System and the Kampo Revival Movement.

sen.j: 1848年：尾張藩医浅井家の第九代樺園（九皐、名は正贇）の長子として、名古屋に生まれる。
sen.e: 1848: He was born the first child of Kaen (or Kyuko, the real first name was Masatoshi), the ninth head of the Azai family, the family of doctors of the Owari Domain, in Nagoya.
1848: He was born as the first child of Kaen (or Kyuko, the real first name was Masatoshi), the ninth head of the Azai family, the family of doctors of the Owari Domain, in Nagoya.
sen.cmt: born the first child --> born as the first child
sen.e: 1848: He was born as the first child of Kaen (or Kyuko, the real first name was Masatoshi), the ninth head of the Azai family, the family of doctors of the Owari Domain, in Nagoya.

sen.j: 1866年：19歳のとき、尾張藩医学代講となる。
sen.e: 1866: He became a substitute teacher at the Owari Domain's medical school at the age of 19.
1866: He became a substitute teacher at the Owari Domain's medical school at the age of 19.
1866: He became a substitute teacher at the Owari Domain's medical school at the age of 19.

sen.j: 1874年8月：医業を許可制とする「医制」が布達される。
sen.e: August 1874: It was proclaimed that 'Isei,' the doctor licensing system, must be introduced.
August 1874: The introduction of 'Isei', the doctor licensing system, was proclaimed.
August 1874: The introduction of 'Isei', the doctor licensing system, was proclaimed.

sen.j: 1875年：漢方医存続の運動が展開され始める。
sen.e: 1875: The movement for the continuance of Kampo doctors started.
1875: The movement for the continuance of Kampo doctors started.
1875: The movement for the continuance of Kampo doctors started.

sen.j: 9月、浅田宗伯ら漢方六賢人が洋方六科を提示。
sen.e: September 1875: Six Wise Men of Kampo including Sohaku ASADA presented six subjects of Western medicine.
September 1875: Six Wise Men of Kampo including Sohaku ASADA presented 洋方六科 (six subjects of Western medicine).
September 1875: Six Wise Men of Kampo including Sohaku ASADA presented 洋方六科 (six subjects of Western medicine).

sen.j: 1876年：新たに医業を行うには洋方六科試験合格が必要となることを内務省が通達（ただし、漢方医は一代限り既得権を認める）。
sen.e: 1876: The Department of Interior announced that passing examinations of the six subjects of Western medicine would be necessary to start to practice medicine from then on (except for Kampo doctors, who were allowed to continue working for their lifetimes without passing the examinations).

1876: The Ministry of Home Affairs announced that passing examinations of the six subjects of Western medicine would be necessary to start medical practice (except that Kampo doctors were allowed to continue working in their lifetime without passing the examination).
sen.cmt: The Department of Interior→The Ministry of Home Affairsその他表現を見直しました。
sen.e: 1876: The Ministry of Home Affairs announced that passing examinations of the six subjects of Western medicine would be necessary to start medical practice (except that Kampo doctors were allowed to continue working in their lifetime without passing the examination).

sen.j: 1879年2月：樺園、国幹父子が中心となり愛知博愛社結成。
sen.e: February 1879: Kaen and his son, Kokkan took the lead in establishing Aichi Hakuaisha (Hakuaisha literally means "philanthropic society"; it was the predecessor of the Japanese Red Cross Society).
February 1879: Kaen and his son, Kokkan took the lead in establishing Aichi Hakuaisha (Hakuaisha literally means "philanthropic society"; it was the predecessor of the Japanese Red Cross Society).
February 1879: Kaen and his son, Kokkan took the lead in establishing Aichi Hakuaisha (Hakuaisha literally means "philanthropic society"; it was the predecessor of the Japanese Red Cross Society).

sen.j: 1879年2月：医師試験が統一の試験となる。
sen.e: February 1879: National Medical Licensing Examination was started.
February 1879: National Medical Licensing Examination was started.
February 1879: National Medical Licensing Examination was started.

sen.j: 1879年3月：旧江戸医学派の山田業広、浅田宗伯（2代目）ら温知社設立。
sen.e: March 1879: Gyoko YAMADA and Sohaku ASADA (the second), former members of Edo Medical School, established Onchisha (literally means "society of the revival of wisdom"; it promoted the continuance of Kampo).

March 1879: Gyoko YAMADA and Sohaku ASADA (the second), former members of Edo Medical School, established Onchisha (literally means "society of the revival of wisdom"; it promoted the continuance of Kampo).

March 1879: Gyoko YAMADA and Sohaku ASADA (the second), former members of Edo Medical School, established Onchisha (literally means "society of the revival of wisdom"; it promoted the continuance of Kampo).

sen.j: 1879年4月：国幹、官許を得て名古屋に皇漢医学校を設立。
sen.e: April 1879: Getting permission by the government, Kokkan established the Imperial Kampo Medical School in Nagoya.
April 1879: Getting permission by the government, Kokkan established the Imperial Kampo Medical School in Nagoya.
April 1879: Getting permission by the government, Kokkan established the Imperial Kampo Medical School in Nagoya.

sen.j: 1879年10月：国幹は、各府県の温知社宛に東京温知社に大同団結するよう文書を発送。
sen.e: October 1879: Kokkan sent Onchisha based on different prefectures written requests saying he would like them to unite one another and cooperate with Tokyo Onchisha.
October 1879: Kokkan sent each Onchisha of different prefectures a letter saying he would like them to unite one another and cooperate with Tokyo Onchisha.
sen.cmt: 先頭部の表現を見直しました。
sen.e: October 1879: Kokkan sent each Onchisha of different prefectures a letter saying he would like them to unite one another and cooperate with Tokyo Onchisha.

sen.j: 1881年：神田に皇漢医学講習所を設立。
sen.e: 1881: Imperial Kampo Institute was founded in Kanda.
1881: Imperial Kampo Institute was founded in Kanda.
1881: Imperial Kampo Institute was founded in Kanda.

sen.j: 温知社全国大会で国幹が第三代議長に選出される。
sen.e: Kokkan was elected third chairman in the Onchisha National Convention.
Kokkan was elected the third chairman in the Onchisha National Convention.
sen.cmt: third chaimanに定冠詞を付与しました。
sen.e: Kokkan was elected the third chairman in the Onchisha National Convention.

sen.j: 1882年11月：国幹の奔走により、愛知博愛社・東京温知社・京都賛育社・熊本杏雨社が大同団結。
sen.e: November 1882: Due to Kokkan's efforts, Aichi Hakuaisha, Tokyo Onchisha, Kyoto Sanikusha, and Kumamoto Kyousha united for the common purpose.
November 1882: Due to Kokkan's efforts, Aichi Hakuaisha, Tokyo Onchisha, Kyoto Sanikusha, and Kumamoto Kyousha united for the common purpose.
November 1882: Due to Kokkan's efforts, Aichi Hakuaisha, Tokyo Onchisha, Kyoto Sanikusha, and Kumamoto Kyousha united for the common purpose.

sen.j: 1883年：全国社員の寄付により和漢医学講習所（のち東京温知学校）設立。
sen.e: 1883: The Institute of Chinese and Japanese Medical Science (later Tokyo Onchi School) was founded with donations from members all over Japan.
1883: The Institute of Chinese and Japanese Medical Science (later Tokyo Onchi School) was founded with donations from members all over Japan.
1883: The Institute of Chinese and Japanese Medical Science (later Tokyo Onchi School) was founded with donations from members all over Japan.

sen.j: 館主：国幹、副館主：山田業精。
sen.e: The director: Kokkan, the deputy director: Gyoko YAMADA.
The director: Kokkan, the deputy director: Gyoko YAMADA.
The director: Kokkan, the deputy director: Gyoko YAMADA.

sen.j: この後、漢方医継続の請願を繰り返すがことごとく却下される。
sen.e: After the foundation of the Institute, they repeatedly petitioned for the continuance of Kampo doctors, but their requests were refused every time.
After the foundation of the Institute, they repeatedly petitioned for the continuance of Kampo doctors, but their requests were refused every time.
After the foundation of the Institute, they repeatedly petitioned for the continuance of Kampo doctors, but their requests were refused every time.

sen.j: 1883年10月：太政官布告により「医師資格制度」を法律化。
sen.e: October 1883: 'Law of Doctor Licensing System' was enacted by Dajokan (the authorities).
October 1883: 'Law of Doctor Licensing System' was enacted by Dajokan fukoku (proclamation by the Grand Council of State).
sen.cmt: Dajokan (the authorities) --> Dajokan fukoku (proclamation by the Grand Council of State)
sen.e: October 1883: 'Law of Doctor Licensing System' was enacted by Dajokan fukoku (proclamation by the Grand Council of State).

sen.j: 1884年：「医業開業試験規則」、「医師免許規則」施行。
sen.e: 1884: 'Examination Regulations on Practicing Medicine' and 'Regulations on Doctor Licenses' came into force.
1884: 'Examination Regulations on Practicing Medicine' and 'Regulations on Doctor Licenses' came into force.
1884: 'Examination Regulations on Practicing Medicine' and 'Regulations on Doctor Licenses' came into force.

sen.j: 1887年1月：有力幹部の死、請願運動停滞から会費未納増により温知社解散。
sen.e: January 1887: Onchisha was dissolved due to the deaths of leading leaders and the increase of unpaid membership fees because of ceased petitions.
January 1887: Onchisha was dissolved due to the deaths of influential leaders and the increase of unpaid membership fees due to inactive petition activity.
sen.cmt: leading leaders→influential leadersbecause of ceased petitions→due to inactive petition activity
sen.e: January 1887: Onchisha was dissolved due to the deaths of influential leaders and the increase of unpaid membership fees due to inactive petition activity.

sen.j: 1891年：全国3000の同士により帝国医界を結成。
sen.e: 1891: Kokkan formed the imperial medical community with 3,000 fellows across the country.
1891: Kokkan formed the imperial medical community with 3,000 fellows across the country.
1891: Kokkan formed the imperial medical community with 3,000 fellows across the country.

sen.j: 第1回帝国議会に向け議会闘争に入る。
sen.e: They started the campaign for the first Imperial Diet.
They started the political campaign for the first Imperial Diet.
They started the political campaign for the first Imperial Diet.

sen.j: 1895年：第8回帝国議会にて、漢方医提出の「医師免許規則改正法案」27票差で否決。
sen.e: 1895: 'Bill to Amend the Regulations on Doctor Licenses' submitted by Kampo doctors was rejected by 27 votes in the eighth Imperial Diet.
1895: 'Bill to Amend the Regulations on Doctor Licenses' submitted by Kampo doctors was rejected by a margin of 27 votes in the eighth Imperial Diet.
sen.cmt: by 27 votes --> by a margin of 27 votes
sen.e: 1895: 'Bill to Amend the Regulations on Doctor Licenses' submitted by Kampo doctors was rejected by a margin of 27 votes in the eighth Imperial Diet.

sen.j: 1900年：名古屋に帰郷。
sen.e: 1900: He went back to Nagoya.
1900: He went back to Nagoya.
1900: He went back to Nagoya.

sen.j: 1903年：55歳にて永眠。
sen.e: 1903: He died at the age of 55.
1903: He died at the age of 55.
1903: He died at the age of 55.

sen.j: 著作
sen.e: Book
Literary work
Literary work

sen.j: 浅井国幹『浅井氏家譜大成』医聖社、1980年復刻
sen.e: "Azai-shi Kakei Taisei" (The Complete Genealogy of the Azai Family) written by Kokkan AZAI; its facsimile edition was published by Iseisha in 1980
"Azai-shi Kakei Taisei" (The Complete Genealogy of the Azai Family) written by Kokkan AZAI; its reprinted edition was published by Iseisha in 1980.
"Azai-shi Kakei Taisei" (The Complete Genealogy of the Azai Family) written by Kokkan AZAI; its reprinted edition was published by Iseisha in 1980.
